name: Instant Pot® Ribs from Frozen
author: thedailygourmet
summary: These ribs start from a frozen state, so dinner can be made without planning ahead. Each rib portion should have 3 to 4 ribs. I use a spice called "Red Rocks Hickory Smoke Seasoning" from Savory Spice Shop®, but you may use what you have. With only 3 ingredients, it doesn't get much easier!
ingredients: 3 tablespoons hickory smoke seasoning (such as Savory Spice® Red Rocks)
1 rack frozen baby back ribs, membrane removed and cut into 4 slabs
directions: Pour water into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®)
Sprinkle seasoning liberally over the frozen ribs and set on top of the trivet
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 45 minutes
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 15 minutes
Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
Transfer ribs to a rimmed baking sheet
